channel.title: Bat to jar
channel.description: hello i need help how i can make a .bat file to a .jar

item.title: Bat to jar
item.dc:creator: @I_InDrEk_I I InDrEk I
item.description:
@I_InDrEk_I wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:6, topic:418852”][quote author=I InDrEk I link=topic=521384.msg3788844#msg3788844 date=1319125910]

[quote author=Sagi link=topic=521384.msg3788841#msg3788841 date=1319125070]

Lol why would you need to make bat file to jar?
[/quote]So just basically replacing the batch with a jar?
To make it work on Mac or for webclient?

OT: Use a Jar Maker to do so, try this link: http://www.softpedia.com/get/Programming/Other-Programming-Files/JAR-Maker.shtml

or google it?
[/quote]I think he just wanted to make his hole client to jar not actually the .bat

The batch file is just a convenience so that you don’t have to type in all the CLAs every time he wants to execute it.

The easiest way to do it is just to jar the client with a Main-class attribute, and some arguments for nodeid, portoff, etc[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Bat to jar
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“I InDrEk I, post:5, topic:418852”][quote author=Sagi link=topic=521384.msg3788841#msg3788841 date=1319125070]

Lol why would you need to make bat file to jar?

To make it work on Mac or for webclient?

OT: Use a Jar Maker to do so, try this link: http://www.softpedia.com/get/Programming/Other-Programming-Files/JAR-Maker.shtml

or google it?
[/quote]I think he just wanted to make his hole client to jar not actually the .bat[/quote]

The batch file is just a convenience so that you don’t have to type in all the CLAs every time he wants to execute it.

The easiest way to do it is just to jar the client with a Main-class attribute, and some arguments for nodeid, portoff, etc

Read full topic
